item.title: Soumya add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Soumya add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Soumya add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "Is that a bulletproof vest? See, now that's so insulting. That's like saying I'm not smart enough to shoot you in the head." Eddie DeChooch" -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Soumya add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "As far as I'm concerned, if something is so complicated that you can't explain it in 10 seconds, then it's probably not worth knowing anyway." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Soumya add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken
